answers.answer: Well it's definitely worth a shot.. My Dh is Lebanese . We cook Greek all the time. He is not all the crazy about tilapia , but we love other fish.... Eating healthy no one can go wrong weather they are trying to conceive or not... Thanks for the info.... Mary..:).

question: Thought I'd post this blurb I read in Redbook.  "Eat this, make a baby.  Okay, so that's not exactly how it works, but your food choices may make you more likely to conceive.  A study found that women who ate a Mediterranean-style diet including lots of fish, beans, nuts, whole grains, and veggies were 40 percent more likely to end up preggers than those following a Western diet.  "One key could be vitamin B6, found in vegetable oils, seeds, and nuts--it may increase chances of conception and lower risk of early miscarriage," says study author Marijana Vujkovic, Ph.D.   Eating this way is a smart move anyhow, since it may the risk of diabetes, cancer and Alzheimer's.  There's just no reason not to go Greek."  Worth a shot, huh?
title: Eat this, make a baby--title on article in mag
